text:
League 1
OL: a departure recorded in December?
Bernard Lacombe, historical figure and pillar of the OL institution, is expected to retire in December.
06 Nov 2019, 12:01 by Mourad Bennis



Alfred GomisDijonIcon Sport



Youcef AtalOGC NiceIcon Sport



William SalibaASSEIcon Sport



Edson MexerBordeauxIcon Sport



Jordan AmaviOMIcon Sport



Didier NdongDijonIcon Sport



Baptiste SantamariaAngersIcon Sport



Gael KakutaAmiensIcon Sport



Ui-jo HwangBordeauxIcon Sport



Memphis DepayOLIcon Sport



Denis BouangaASSEIcon Sport



St√©phane JobardDijonIcon Sport

Bouanga, Depay, Amavi ... the typical team of the weekend in Ligue 1




A page will probably turn to Lyon. In December, Bernard Lacombe will take a step back on the sporting situation of OL. The right arm of President Aulas, who is a historical figure of Les Gones, will retire.




Bernard Lacombe will bow




Bernard Lacombe + 12 üì∑Credit Photo - Icon Sport

A historical figure from OL is on the start. Bernard Lacombe, a 67-year-old adviser to President Aulas, will retire in December. He said in the show "Team Duga" on RMC: "I'm going to retire in December" (...). Lyon is my club, I played ten years and I stayed forty years after. "The former French international has decided to give more time to his family.
His loyalty to the Rhone club has been remarkable. Moreover, for several decades, Lacombe has always weighed on the fate of Lyon. He had started his professional career at OL in December 1969. Playing over 250 games with Les Gones, he scored 149 goals. After passing through Saint-Etienne and Bordeaux, he had at the end of the 1980s taken over the reins of OL as assistant coach of R. Domenech before passing number 1 in 1996.
